# English Numerals
This C++ code can convert every nonnegative integer into an English numeral that follows the Conway-Guy system and uses the short scale. It is noted that the output is closer to American English than British English, i.e., the word *and* is not used anywhere in the whole part of a number.

## How to Use
1. Compile the code into an executable file and open it.
2. Input an nonnegative integer and press Enter.
3. The corresponding English numeral is output.

## Restrictions
1. The input must be not larger than 10^(2^63 - 1) - 1.
2. When the output is more than 2^63 - 1 characters (including spaces), the output may be inaccurate.

## Trivia
Although the equivalent numeral of one googolplex (10^(10^100)) is marked as *n/a* in the Wikipedia page stated in the reference, it is pretty easy to convert manually with basic arithmetic. The answer is below. The explanation is left to you.  
One googolplex = Ten 

## Reference
Wikipedia contributors. (2021, October 5). *Names of large numbers*. Wikipedia. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Names_of_large_numbers
